summary: This bill, the Research and Development Tax Credit Expansion Act of 2025, aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to expand eligibility and simplify the research credit for certain small businesses. Key provisions include adjustments for inflation, making the credit refundable against unemployment taxes, expanding the definition of a qualified small business, and modifying the alternative simplified credit for new and small businesses. The changes are effective for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
